The applicability of the Act extends to the people of all faiths, including Hindus, Muslims, Sikhs, Christians, Jains, and Buddhists, across India. The minimum age to get married under the SMA is 21 years for males and 18 years for females.

question: In which year was the Indian Parliamentary Group established? SSC CGL 05/12/2022 (4th Shift)

solution.explanation: In 1949, The Indian Parliamentary Group was an autonomous body formed in the year 1949 in pursuance of a motion adopted by the Constituent Assembly (Legislative) on 16th August 1948. Speaker of Lok Sabha is its ex-oﬃcio President.

question: If the State government dissolves the Panchayati Raj Institutions before the end of their ﬁve-year term, fresh elections should ordinarily be held within _____. SSC CGL 12/12/2022 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Six months. Under Article 243 E - An election to constitute a Panchayat shall be completed - Before the expiry of its duration speciﬁed in clause (1) or before the expiration of a period of six months from the date of its dissolution.

question: Which freedom is considered as the ‘Hallmark of Democracy’? SSC CGL 13/12/2022 (2nd Shift)

solution.correct_answer: B. Right to freedom of religion
solution.explanation: The Right to freedom of Religion (Article 25-28) is considered the Hallmark of Democracy. Fundamental rights are mentioned in Part III (Article 12-35) of the Constitution.

question: The detention of a person cannot exceed ________ unless an advisory board consisting of judges of a High Court reports suﬃcient cause for extended detention. SSC CPO 11/11/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: three months. Article 22 (Part III) grants protection to persons who are arrested or detained (available to both citizens and foreigners). Preventive detention means the detention of a person without trial and conviction by a court.

question: When was the National Emergency declared for the ﬁrst time under Article 352 ? SSC CPO 11/11/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: 1962-68. question: Which freedom ﬁghter abolished the Zamindari System in Uttar Pradesh and was elected as the Home Minister in 1955? SSC MTS 26/07/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Govind Ballabh Pant successfully abolished the exploitative Zamindari system and revolutionised laws pertaining to women’s inheritance and marriage. question: As per the coding convention of India Census, how many digit code is used for showing state code? SSC CHSL 03/06/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: 2. The coding convention used: State code (2 digits); District code (3 digits); Sub-district code (5 digits); Village code (6 digits).

question: On which day was the National Emblem of India adopted ? SSC CGL 11/04/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: 26th January 1950. The state emblem is an adaptation from the Sarnath Lion Capital of Ashoka. Motto- Satyameva Jayate ("Truth Alone Triumphs") is taken from the "Mundaka Upanishad", a part of Upanishads.

question: The Right of Children to Free and Compulsory Education Act 2009 is an Act of Parliament which came into force in: SSC CGL 11/04/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: 2010. The Act makes education a fundamental right of every child between the ages of 6 and 14 and speciﬁes minimum norms in elementary schools.

question: In which of the following years was an Act enacted to provide for the reorganisation of the states of India and for matters connected therewith? SSC CGL 12/04/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: 1956. The States Reorganisation Act, 1956 was a major reform of the boundaries of India's states and territories, organising them along linguistic lines. The Government divided the country into 14 states and 6 union territories under the State Reorganisation Act.

question: Which of the following Acts was passed by the Government of India to inquire into allegations of corruption against certain public functionaries? SSC MTS 11/10/2021 (Afternoon)

question: The Indian Forest Act 1927 was enacted after repealing which of the following Indian forest acts? SSC CGL 23/08/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Indian Forest Act, 1878. The Indian Forest Act of 1878 divided Indian forests into reserved forests (completely government-controlled), protected forests (partially government-controlled) and village forests (controlled by abutting villages).

question: One-third of the members of the Vidhan Parishad retire every ______ years. SSC CHSL 06/08/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: two years. Vidhan Parishad or Legislative Council is a permanent body, which can be formed or abolished when the Legislative Assembly passes a special resolution.

question: On the night of ______ 1975, Indira Gandhi recommended the imposition of Emergency to president Fakhruddin Ali Ahmed. SSC CPO 23/11/2020 (Evening)

solution.explanation: 25th June. The third emergency of India started at the mid night of 25th June 1975 and was extended till 23 March 1977. The main reason for this emergency was “internal disturbances”. First emergency of India was started on 26 October 1962 (India-China war). The second emergency was during the India-Pakistan war from 3-17 December 1971.
